entry.title: [EU+CA] Public Cloud control panel unavailable, VPS order funnel
entry.content:
Jul 7, 09:22 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 05/07/2023 04:00 UTC
End Time : 05/07/2023 07:07 UTC

On July 5th 06:03 am CEST, OVHcloud has identified a partial unavailability of its services affecting Public Cloud and VPS customers.

During this time, the management of the following services was degraded: Compute, Storage, Network, Containers & orchestration. Access to data on Standard Object Storage Swift & Cloud Archive was not possible. Access to the Public Cloud segment of the OVHcloud manager was also unavailable. No data was lost during the incident.

Concerning VPS, ordering, upgrade, reinstallation and unsubscribe were unavailable as well as Snapshot and Automated backup features.

Resources of both Public Cloud and VPS remained available during the course of the incident, excluding Standard Object Storage Swift and Cloud Archive.

The incident was fixed at 9:07am CEST, thanks to our fully mobilized teams, with a progressive ramp-up to a nominal state up until 11:00am CEST for all affected services.

We sincerely apologize to all affected customers.

Jul 5, 09:28 UTC
Monitoring - Start time : 05/07/2023 02:58 UTC
End Time : 05/07/2023 09:27 UTC
Ongoing actions : Monitoring
A fix has been implemented. We are monitoring the issue for the time being.

Jul 5, 08:02 UTC
Update - The VPS order funnel is degraded, customers may be facing errors while attempting to order a new VPS.
Our technical teams continue to work on the issue.

Jul 5, 07:33 UTC
Update - Further investigation reported impact on api.ovh.com ( limited to /cloud and /vps )

Jul 5, 06:33 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 05/07/2023 02:58 UTC
Service impact : Public Cloud control panel is unavailable due to the Keystone issue.
Related Incident : [EU/BHS/APAC][Publiccloud] - Keystone (authentication) API
Ongoing actions : Investigating
Please follow task to get the next update.
Our technical teams are working on the issue. Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

entry.content:

Resolved - Start time : 21/06/2023 09:49 UTC

Customer panel was also facing errors
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

entry.title: [Global][Support] - Issues contacting Support
entry.content:
Jun 8, 16:30 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 07/06/2023 06:32 UTC
End time : 07/06/2023 15:11 UTC

On Wednesday June 7th at 8:27 AM (CET), a network malfunction impacted the VoIP services of some of our customers.

OVHcloud technical teams immediately intervened to identify the cause of the incident and resolve it. Impacted services have been restored on 07/06/2023 15:11 UTC and are now operational.

You can contact our customer service on 1007 or open a support ticket from your Help Center.

We apologize for any inconvenience this may has caused. We will update our support pages with new information as soon as available.

Jun 7, 15:11 UTC
Update - Impacted services are operational.
We will continue to monitor the situation for the time being.
Further explanation will be post here.
We apologized for the inconvenience.

Jun 7, 13:35 UTC
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Jun 7, 12:32 UTC
Update - All technical teams are hands on impacted services.
We are doing our very best to resolved the issue.

Jun 7, 09:44 UTC
Update - Our technicians are still currently working on in order to fix this situation.

Jun 7, 08:21 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 07/06/2023 06:32 UTC
Service impact : You may have difficulty contacting your customer service on 1007.
Related Incident : https://web-cloud.status-ovhcloud.com/incidents/8hqngk137spw
Ongoing actions : Our technical teams are working on the issue. Update will be post as significant progress is made.
Workaround : You can call long number 09 72 10 1007 (only for France) or open a support ticket from your Help Center.
